title: Valerija Galić
text:
Valerija Galić (born 13 October 1956 in <a href="Split%20%28city%29">Split</a>) is a Bosnian judge, vicepresident of the <a href="Constitutional%20Court%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>.
Biography.
Born in <a href="Split%20%28city%29">Split</a>, Galić attended the First High School in <a href="Sarajevo">Sarajevo</a> and graduated from the <a href="Sarajevo%20Law%20School">Sarajevo Law School</a> in 1981. The same year she started working as a law clerk with the Secretariat for Legislation of the then Executive Council of the Assembly of the <a href="Socialist%20Republic%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Socialist Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>. She then conducted judicial practice at First Municipal Court of Sarajevo and passed the bar exam in 1982. She was employed as a law assistant, then advisor and assistant secretary in charge of legislation of the Executive Council of the Government of the <a href="Republic%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> until 1996, when she was appointed as the Secretary of the Office for Legislation of the Government of the <a href="Federation%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Federation of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>. She attended trainings by <a href="USAID">USAID</a> and by the <a href="ECtHR">ECtHR</a>, and served as law examiner for public employees. In 1999 she was a member of the Commission for Harmonization of Legal System with the European legislation.
On 30 July 2002 she was appointed judge of the <a href="Constitutional%20Court%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Constitutional Court of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a>, taking up office in February 2003. From 2006 to 2012 she served twice as the Vice-President of the Court, before being appointed President from 2012 to 2015.
She is a co-author and reviewer of several professional publications and participated in several national and international conferences on constitutional judiciary and the protection of human rights and fundamental freedoms.
